review.body: This is the second in the series and for me it was my favorite one. You fall right back into the story and are pulled in from the first page. It's time for the Spinmaker Arts Festival and the town is all a buzz with excitement. But when some one is murdered and a shard of glass is what killed her...
Such a good book!

Worth reading

The book was well written. Some parts were a bit annoying and I felt like shouting at Finlay because he didn't get it sometimes and with his background I expected him to be more aware. Having said that I had to read more and more as the chapters developed and had a few later nights t...

As a featured Author of 2016's NBCC, I selected "Beater" as my book club's selection of the month but unfortunately it was just an ok read for me.

Coming out the gates with an intensely captivating opening, "Beater" had potential to be a 5 star read. However, it strings you along to a predictably...
How many times to people have to say that communication is key? Not annoyed, just bored.
Heartbreaking and powerful, yet hopeful as well, this is a book I'll never forget
Great book!

I love Jack Reacher

Fast paced, typical of Lee Child. Lots of interesting plot twists. Stayed up too late just to find out the ending.

book.title: A Darker Shade of Magic (Shades of Magic, #1)

review.body: fast paced and exciting magic fun times. i made noises. intrigued about where this story is going. to the sequel!

Important subject matter but a frustrating read

I am glad the author wrote this book because we need to remember the atrocities that happened in Germany, but the story was frustrating to read. The first half was quite long and detailed, and the last few chapters left out the details I'd been waiti...

This is the second in the series and for me it was my favorite one. You fall right back into the story and are pulled in from the first page. It's time for the Spinmaker Arts Festival and the town is all a buzz with excitement. But when some one is murdered and a shard of glass is what killed her...

book.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4)

review.body: I'm official a Harry Potter fan! I loved this book it had a lot of twists and turns! But, oh no....the dark lord has return! Can't wait to read more! Onward to the fifth year! Happy Reading!

This is the first graphic novel I have ever read, and I would never have picked it up if it weren’t for the #VTReadingChallenge, in which “a graphic novel” is one of the categories. I stood, hesitatingly, in front of the shelves of adult graphic novels at my library. Everything looked strange, an...
Decent romance

book.title: Creating a Beautiful Mess: Ten Essential Play Experiences for a Joyous Childhood

review.body: Most of this seemed very obvious to me, but unfortunately it's a much needed message. Well-written, without being negative or judgemental, a good read for parents of pre-schoolers. Skimming is made easy by short and clearly labeled sections.

Hanging Pawns is the second book in the Fate series. It's set before Adjournment (the first in the series) and is from Mea's point of view.

When reading Adjournment I enjoyed Mea's character and wondered more about her story so it was great to read Hanging Pawns and learn Mea and Josh's story.

Ther...

book.title: Devil to Pay (Night Huntress - Complete World #3.5)

review.body:
Devil to pay

I am glad to pick up another novel of Jeaniene see Cat and Bone make a drop into a storyline. I miss them and there characters filling pages of twisted plots dealing with vamps. However, I enjoyed this novel and looking into others of hers that I haven't read. Which are very few becau...
Actual rating: 4.5.

The Worth The Fight series is one of my very favorites. I was thrilled to get this ARC. Travis "Texas" has been just lurking around in the background for 5 books, tipping his hat and loving to fight. His story was worth the wait. His evolution from single with never any ties, to deny any type of...

The Three Pigs by David Wiesner is a fun twist on the classic book The Three Little Pigs. The book starts the same way as the classic but soon takes an unexpected turn when the pigs figure out how to get out of their story and into other classic children’s books leaving the big bad wolf confused...
